metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23017 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A security issue in nginx resolver was identified, which might allow an attacker who is able to forge UDP packets from the DNS server to cause 1-byte memory overwrite, resulting in worker process crash or potential other impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-23017` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnginx-mod-http-auth-pam - 1.18.0-6ubuntu9
libnginx-mod-http-cache-purge - 1.18.0-6ubuntu9
libnginx-mod-http-dav-ext - 1.18.0-6ubuntu9
libnginx-mod-http-echo - 1.18.0-6ubuntu9
libnginx-mod-http-fancyindex - 1.18.0-6ubuntu9
libnginx-mod-http-geoip - 1.18.0-6ubuntu9
libnginx-mod-http-geoip2 - 1.18.0-6ubuntu9
libnginx-mod-http-headers-more-filter - 1.18.0-6ubuntu9
libnginx-mod-http-image-filter - 1.18.0-6ubuntu9
libnginx-mod-http-ndk - 1.18.0-6ubuntu9
libnginx-mod-http-perl - 1.18.0-6ubuntu9
libnginx-mod-http-subs-filter - 1.18.0-6ubuntu9
libnginx-mod-http-uploadprogress - 1.18.0-6ubuntu9
libnginx-mod-http-upstream-fair - 1.18.0-6ubuntu9
libnginx-mod-http-xslt-filter - 1.18.0-6ubuntu9
libnginx-mod-mail - 1.18.0-6ubuntu9
libnginx-mod-nchan - 1.18.0-6ubuntu9
libnginx-mod-rtmp - 1.18.0-6ubuntu9
libnginx-mod-stream - 1.18.0-6ubuntu9
libnginx-mod-stream-geoip - 1.18.0-6ubuntu9
libnginx-mod-stream-geoip2 - 1.18.0-6ubuntu9
nginx - 1.18.0-6ubuntu9
nginx-common - 1.18.0-6ubuntu9
nginx-core - 1.18.0-6ubuntu9
nginx-extras - 1.18.0-6ubuntu9
nginx-full - 1.18.0-6ubuntu9
nginx-light - 1.18.0-6ubuntu9
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Luis Merino, Markus Vervier, Eric Sesterhenn

criterions.comment: nginx package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.18.0-6ubuntu9').
